Grands Projets division

Patrick Kadri, born in 1996, holds an engineering degree from the École Centrale Paris. He joined Dumez Ile-de-France in 1991 as a price studies engineer before becoming a works engineer in 1994.

In 1997, he joined Dumez-GTM as project director at the wastewater treatment plant in Bogota, Colombia, before being appointed deputy to the director of the Sao Paolo agency in Brazil in 1999. In 2003, he joined the management committee of Socatop, then became Development Director for VINCI Construction Grands Projets in France in 2004. He was appointed director of the Southern Europe and Romania sector in 2007, enlarged to include Turkey in 2009 and the exceptional bridge and tunnel structures division in early 2011.

He was appointed Operations Director for France & Mediterranean Europe in June 2011 and Operations Director for France, Mediterranean, Africa, Near East & LNG storage facilities activities in October 2012.

He was appointed CEO of VINCI Construction Grands Projets in January 2018 and Chairman in November the same year.

As of February 2021, Patrick Kadri heads the Grands Projets division within the VINCI Construction pole.
